result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler J Green

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Request to Lift the No Contact. Control Plan filed.

Defendant Tyler J Green in court.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:18 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance. State provides copy of criminal complaint to the defendant, and Court goes over charges and penalties. DE wishes to waive attorney - Court provides form to the defendant, and will recall the case.
Case recalled @ 2:37 p.m. - Court responds to further questions of the defendant as to waiver and no contact. Defendant would like to get an attorney. Court in recess.
Recalled @ 2:52 p.m. - Defendant changed his mind and filled out waiver so he can talk to the State before determining if he needs an attorney. Court goes over waiver form with the defendant who responds to Court's questions. Court finds waiver knowing, voluntary, intelligent. Defendant to set up appointment with the prosecutor, (Berg) after court to discussion the case. Court sets out about 60 + days to see if matter resolved, defendant has attorney. Matter set before assigned judge - Johnson
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Timelines
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Victim's request to lift the no contact (S.G.)
Victim's request to lift the no contact (A.G.)
Victim's request to lift the no contact (L.G.)
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH S.N.W. dob 8-13-1987 or RESIDENCE or HER CHILDREN. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4556 thru 22-4559

Defendant Tyler J Green in court, in custody by video. Attorney Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jason Daane appeared. Signature bond set. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
